data.name: OC00132-AWS CloudWatch Log Group Deletion

data.name: Custom: Network-Multiple connections to uncategorized or suspicious sites
data.description: Endpoint connection to uncategorized site or site traffic.

data.name: OC00160: Brute Force-Credential Stuffing-NTLM-LST-Windows
data.description: A potential attacker is attempting to gain access to an internal system and is using a list or isn't aware of specific user accounts and using generic/well known user accounts in a brute force attack. Each user/account is only attempted once with a singlaur password before moving on to another host such as a password spray. This may be an indicator of a larger reconnaissance, campaign or penetration test.

data.name: Custom: Network-Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) alert
data.query: NOT panw.panos.action : ("block" or "drop" ) AND NOT log.level: ("informational" or "low" OR "medium"  ) AND NOT source.address: ("10.117.195.10" OR "10.117.138.52" OR "209.177.165.160") AND destination.ip: "10.120.51.75"

data.name: OC00042-Multiple Accounts Disabled by Same User Windows
data.description: A malicious actor is attempting to evade detection by disabling accounts used in an attack or executing a denial of service attack against specific users. This may be an indicator of a larger reconnaissance, campaign or penetration test or a disgruntled employee.

data.name: Custom: Network-Multiple connections to known malicious site
data.description: Alert when Multiple connections to known malicious site is detected
data.query: network.application: "web-browsing" AND NOT log.level :( "low" OR "informational" ) AND panw.panos.action: "allow" AND network.direction: "outbound"

data.name: OC00030-Excessive Account Lockouts
data.description: This use case is intended to catch brute force within a client environment that would not otherwise be caught by our internal brute force rules. The use case will alert on an excessive number of account lockouts witnessed within the client environment in a short period of time

data.name: Threat Intel IP Address Indicator Match
data.description: This rule is triggered when an IP address indicator from the Threat Intel Filebeat module or integrations has a match against a network event.

note.label: Osquery - Retrieve All Services
note.query: SELECT description, display_name, name, path, pid, service_type, start_type, status, user_account FROM services

note.label: Osquery - Retrieve Services Running on User Accounts
note.query:
SELECT description, display_name, name, path, pid, service_type, start_type, status, user_account FROM services WHERE
NOT (user_account LIKE '%LocalSystem' OR user_account LIKE '%LocalService' OR user_account LIKE '%NetworkService' OR
user_account == null)

note.label: Osquery - Retrieve Service Unsigned Executables with Virustotal Link
note.query:
SELECT concat('https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/', sha1) AS VtLink, name, description, start_type, status, pid,
services.path FROM services JOIN authenticode ON services.path = authenticode.path OR services.module_path =
authenticode.path JOIN hash ON services.path = hash.path WHERE authenticode.result != 'trusted'

author: Elastic
data.threat_query: @timestamp >= "now-30d/d" and event.module:(threatintel or ti_*) and threat.indicator.ip:* and not labels.is_ioc_transform_source:"true"

last_execution.message: The following indices are missing the timestamp override field

data.name: OC00090: IPS Alerts of Interest-LST-Palo
data.description: A malicious actor has attempted to gain access to the network and the IP has identified the attempt. An event or alert has been created for unblocked traffic that is of high or critical severity and should be investigated further.

data.name: Kerberos Traffic from Unusual Process
data.description: Identifies network connections to the standard Kerberos port from an unusual process. On Windows, the only process that normally performs Kerberos traffic from a domain joined host is lsass.exe.
author: Elastic
false_positives: HTTP traffic on a non standard port. Verify that the destination IP address is not related to a Domain Controller.

data.name: OC00079-Network Mapping Internal Vertical Scan
data.description: Internal scanning activity is observed against multiple ports from a specific service and from the same source to the same destination in search of a known vulnerability. This may be an indicator of a larger reconnaissance, campaign or penetration test.

data.name: Varonis
data.description: Fire on any event

data.name: OC00099-Data Destruction Activity
data.description: Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources. This rule gets triggered when file deletion events coming from the Microsoft Windows System are observed in very high rate in a short amount of time.

data.name: OC00158-Brute Force-NTLM-LST-Windows
data.description: Adversaries with no prior knowledge of legitimate credentials within the system or environment may guess passwords to attempt access to accounts. Without knowledge of the password for an account, an adversary may opt to systematically guess the password using a repetitive or iterative mechanism. An adversary may guess login credentials without prior knowledge of system or environment passwords during an operation by using a list of common passwords. Password guessing may or may not take into account the target's policies on password complexity or use policies that may lock accounts out after a number of failed attempts.

data.name: Volume Shadow Copy Deleted or Resized via VssAdmin(custom)
data.description: The following example (based on the prebuilt rule Volume Shadow Copy Deleted or Resized via VssAdmin) detects when the vssadmin delete shadows Windows command is executed:

data.name: Endpoint Security
data.description: Generates a detection alert each time an Elastic Endpoint Security alert is received. Enabling this rule allows you to immediately begin investigating your Endpoint alerts.
author: Elastic

last_execution.message: The rule's max alerts per run setting (10000) is greater than the Kibana alerting limit (1000). The rule will only write a maximum of 1000 alerts per rule run.

data.name: Unusual Process For a Linux Host
data.description: Identifies rare processes that do not usually run on individual hosts, which can indicate execution of unauthorized services, malware, or persistence mechanisms. Processes are considered rare when they only run occasionally as compared with other processes running on the host.
author: Elastic
false_positives: A newly installed program or one that runs rarely as part of a monthly or quarterly workflow could trigger this alert.

last_execution.message: An error occurred during rule execution: message: "rare_process_by_host_linux_ecs,v2_rare_process_by_host_linux_ecs missing"

data.name: OC00157-Brute Force - Kerberos - Windows
data.description: Adversaries with no prior knowledge of legitimate credentials within the system or environment may guess passwords to attempt access to accounts. Without knowledge of the password for an account, an adversary may opt to systematically guess the password using a repetitive or iterative mechanism. An adversary may guess login credentials without prior knowledge of system or environment passwords during an operation by using a list of common passwords. Password guessing may or may not take into account the target's policies on password complexity or use policies that may lock accounts out after a number of failed attempts.

data.name: OC00166-Potential Excessive File Modification Activity
data.description: A malicious actor may be attempting to modify files to encrypt them to render the stored data inaccessible. This may lead to additional compromise if it is related to malicious software.

data.name: Palo:Wildfire alert
data.description: malicious wildfire Palo Alto alert

data.name: Spike in Logon Events from a Source IP
data.description: A machine learning job found an unusually large spike in successful authentication events from a particular source IP address. This can be due to password spraying, user enumeration or brute force activity.
author: Elastic
false_positives: Build servers and CI systems can sometimes trigger this alert. Security test cycles that include brute force or password spraying activities may trigger this alert.

data.name: OC00038-High Number of Outbound ICMP
data.description: A malicious actor has obtained the target data and is attempting to exfiltrate it and hide it within ICMP traffic. A malicious actor can also use this for command and control communication
data.query: ) and not client.bytes:(0 or 56 or 64 or 32 or 70) and client.packets: 1
